snippet: Spending rose just 0.2 percent, but any economic slowdown is likely to be mitigated by a strengthening housing sector and tightening labor market.
abstract: Commerce Department reports consumer spending rose 0.2 percent in June, compared with rise of 0.7 percent in May; slow pace suggests lethargy in economy at end of second quarter.
lead_paragraph: Spending rose just 0.2 percent, but any economic slowdown is likely to be mitigated by a strengthening housing sector and tightening labor market.

headline.main: Consumer Spending, and Economic Momentum, Slowed in June
headline.print_headline: Mixed Signals in Reports on Strength of Economy
